content: the eric cowl by kay litton my husband requested a simple cowl to wear while he rides his motorcycle taking his requests i came up with this very easy and fast knit it is perfect for a last-minute gift the instructions below are for a longer cowl that is to be worn doubled over as in the photos but you could take this idea and make it larger or smaller depending on how you would like for it to fit now let s talk about what you need to get started yarn approximately 165 yards/75 grams of worsted weight yarn sample was knit in knit picks swish worsted in the cobblestone heather colorway 100% superwash merino wool 110 yards/50 grams needles us 8/5 0mm circular needles 16 cable you could also use double pointed needles or work this up in magic loop using a longer cabled circular materials - stitch marker - tapestry needle for weaving in ends gauge unblocked 4 25 stitches/6 5 row per 1 inch finished size unblocked approximately 12 in length/14 in circumference - unstretched key links co cast on sts stitches german twisted cast on k knit https //www youtube com/watch v=ucwmcuiylii&t=126s p purl jeny s surprisingly stretchy bind off bobble bind off https //www youtube com/watch v=ol8az7z_iss&t=346s instructions co 88 sts using german twisted cast on place a stitch marker and join to knit in the round *you can adjust the circumference of the cowl by just casting on more or less stitches just chose a number divisible by 8 round 1 *k6 p2* repeat around repeat round 1 until piece measures approximately 12 long *if you want to make the cowl a different length just repeat round 1 until cowl is the length you prefer bobble using jeny s surprisingly stretch bind off with this bind off be careful not to do it too loosely i try to make it a point to do it a tiny bit tighter than i do other bind offs because it is so stretchy that it can flare when done too loose weave in all ends using tapestry needle if you feel that you need to block your item you can give it a soak and block to the dimensions that you would like my husband was happy with the size the cowl turned out and how it fit so i didn t block the one in the photos and it fits him great and you are done with just the few notes above marked by the asterisks you can make changes to the circumference and/or length of this cowl to make it suited to you i hope you enjoyed knitting this simple and classic cowl the eric cowl by kay litton // crazy sock lady designs // questions or comments contact kay at crazysockladydesigns@gmail com
